column4: ok, another question, under windows when i uninstall a prog sometimes i have to go to other places to delete remenants of the prog, dose ubuntu have the same problem, if not, why?
apt package manager system = reason why its not really a problem.
Thanks, What about third party apps
if they use the package manager system.. no issue..
thisis one of the MANY reasons linux people tend to hate 'self installing exwecutables' that are so common in windows.
when in doubt use  the .deb packages for anything you want to use.
makes sense, What about defragging?
normally never needed
system files? gksudo gedit /path/to/whatever

Hi, Would you know anything about ubuntu's theme engines, its all gotten abit confusing, Some themes that i download work fine, others complain about engines and some seem to have replaced all my icons with question marks, Would really appreciate any time spent on kicking me into touvh
to be honest with you - i just learned how stuff works over the years. and theres a lot of broken/bad theme parts out there on the different web sites.
and with the changes to gnome comming in the future.. i wonder if worrying about themes. is that  worthwhile. :)
i tend to use the gnome-art tool to install a few themes i like. and theres some ppas and themes in the repos i also use.
try moving the hidden files/dirs.. not deleting them :0 to some backup dir.
always a pleasure DR, thanks for the assist
its worth learning what all those 'hidden and other special' dirs do. :) and dont touch the .gvfs dir either
in theory. You rerun 'sudo update-grub' and it 'should' see and add a proper grub menu item for windows - reguardless of what hard drive windows is instgalled on.
Thanks
Beautiful, worked like a charm cheers bye
Hello and Good morning, Any chance i could pick your extensive brain?
i got to run to the EyeDoctor. I will be back in about 2 hrs..
Good lucl lol
